protocol.text: At 7 weeks of age, 7-8 rosette leaves from each of 6 plants were dusted with Carborundum (Fisher) and rub-inoculated with a cotton-stick applicator soaked in virus sap that was diluted and titered as described above. As a control, a corresponding set of six plants were dusted with carborundum and leaves were mock-inoculated with a cotton-stick applicator that was soaked in uninfected turnip sap diluted in phosphate buffer.

a 1.2 mm Harris Micro Punch (Whatman) was used to dissect 3-7 TuMV-GFP foci per leaf into 4 zones under UV illumination at 120 hours after infection. Corresponding leaf punches were dissected from the mock-inoculated plants. Leaf punches were immediately placed into tubes filled with RNAlaterTM solution (Ambion) and stored at -20 C. All the leaf punches from the same treatment and zone were pooled together to yield 8 total samples.

Total RNA was isolated using Phenol-free total RNA isolation Kit --RNAqueousTM (Ambion), and the concentration and quality of each sample were determined spectrophotometrically and validated by Agilent 2100 bioanalyzer.
The RNA samples (50 ng) were then amplified and labeled with the OvationTM Biotin RNA Amplification and Labeling System (NuGEN) according to the manufacturer's protocol.
